content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all occurrences of julia code blocks
    matches = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)```", md, seperators=["\n"]))
    # Remove code fences and join them together with a newline
    return reduce((x, y) -> x * "\n" * y[2], map(m -> m[2], matches), init="")
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all occurrences of julia code blocks in the markdown document. Each match is a tuple with two elements: the full match (including fences and newline) and the inner content of the code block. The map function is used to select only the inner content, then reduce joins them together into one string. If there are multiple consecutive matches, they will be joined by a newline character.
